column1: ## This file is used to auto-filter the hundreds of available species
## into a view of the more common model organisms when the full
## orthologue map is generated. If you want to alter this filter,
## utilize the 'OrthologueSpeciesSummary.txt' file that will be
## generated to view the available species, and trim it to the ones
## you want. Alternatively, when using AnnotatedMatrix the $reset()
## method will remove all applied filters, so that the whole matrix is
## The Entrez `gene_group.gz` file appears to list orthologues
## (nearly) exclusively within taxonomic familes. For example, all
## (nearly - 99.9%+) the orthologues for humans are other vertebrates;
## Notably absent model organisms are E. coli, yeast and
## worm. Homologene has an even more restricted set of species.
## The OrthCount and OrthPerc columns below are relative to human, as
